rev.comment: removing a protection template from a non-protected page ([[User:DumbBOT/Protection|info]])
/* Live and Let Die (1973), The Man with the Golden Gun (1974) and The Spy Who Loved Me (1977) */
/* Skyfall (2012) */ trim out the details and move them to Skyfall page
/* Non-Eon films */ Who cares if McClory died 6 days after CR? He had nothing to do with the first version, only with Thunderball? "Coincidentally"?? I think not. Remove
/* Non-Eon films */ Clean up refs supplied this morning with proper templates
/* Non-Eon films */ Rephrase bit about Sellers
/* Non-Eon films */ Change comma and put some stuff from footnote in text.
/* Non-Eon films */ Providing required citation for Allen's involvement in script. Will later clean up with proper templates this afternoon.
/* Non-Eon films */ This is not a fact. If it is, back it up.
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ update to correct film name now announced
Undid revision 458781927 by [[Special:Contributions/Charlr6|Charlr6]] ([[User talk:Charlr6|talk]]) it's unconfirmed - and with the press conference an hour away, let's play it safe, okay?
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ Naomie Harris has been met to play miss money penny, that is why it was mentioned what role they hoped she could take.
Undid revision 458712718 by [[Special:Contributions/ScottJ|ScottJ]] ([[User talk:ScottJ|talk]])Article uses British English spelling
/* Bond spinoffs, unauthorized films and spoofs */
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ there is no confirmation she will be Moneypenny - confirmation comes from Harris herself, or someone who is conencted to EON, and nobody has said anything

Undid revision 457964895 by [[Special:Contributions/Prisonermonkeys|Prisonermonkeys]] ([[User talk:Prisonermonkeys|talk]])removal of [[WP:WEASEL]] words. The newspaper article says confirmed, so confirmed it is.
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ the articles might say Harris is "confirmed" as Moneypenny, but she's not confirmed until EON say she is
[[:en:WP:CLEANER|WPCleaner]] (v1.09) Repaired link to disambiguation page - [[WP:DPL|(You can help)]] - [[ABC]]
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ Whether it's confirmed or not, I don't see the "beard" news as important. Pierce Brosnan had a beard for part of Die Another Day, and it's not mentioned on that page.

Four new referenced sources. Do you want an actual article directly from Sony or MGM? It hasn't even been confirmed Ralph Riennes will be in it but that is still in the article and it's still a rumour
The cited source OVERTLY says this is a RUMOUR. Cut it out!!!

Undid revision 456857272 by [[Special:Contributions/Charlr6|Charlr6]] ([[User talk:Charlr6|talk]]) Name in infobox should reflect new article title. Bit on singer not correctly formatted, and viewed as questionable by many many other sources
Actually, we state that "Carte Blanche" was DISconfirmed though widely reported, and we limit mention of Skyfall to confirmed registration of domain names. See policy [[WP:CRYSTAL]]

/* Bond 23 (2012) */ Added in that the budget has yet to be confirmed by Eon, Sony and MGM. There is also contradiction as at the top it says "DO NOT ADD ANY POSSIBLE NAMES FOR THE FILM" but we have still mentioned Skyfall and Carte Blanche.

On the page we talk about "Skyfall" and say that these reports have not been confirmed by Eon Productions, Sony or MGM. If that can be in the article then this can be too. But I'll add that it hasn't been confirmed yet just like it has on Skyfall.
/* Bond 23 (2012) */ these are rumors that have not yet been confirmed.

They may be mallicious but it doesn't mean its not true. It's not like we can trust the Daily Mail with the title could potentially be Skyfall. Why is that on here as a potential title? Thats just a rumour and hasn't been confirmed by MGM at all.
The sun is a malicious gossip tabloid which seriously should be questioned re policies [[WP:RELIABLE]]
What I added in was sourced and referenced.
Updating image to untagged, which falls within better size guidelines
